skillTree.localised_description: A general's horse can be their most trusted and daring companion. Just don't name him 'Daisy'.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: An Imperial pegasus is a noble, winged steed, intelligent and loyal.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Those who bear the Mark of Hysh are practitioners of the magical Lore of Light, and the bane of Chaos, for they are able to control and manipulate the White Wind of Magic.
The relentless drive and fury of the Hammer, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +10% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +20% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: With years of experience, the wizard refines their craft and casts more efficiently.
Throwing caution to the winds, the wizard digs deep, leaving themselves empowered but mentally frayed.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve minimum: +1
	(own armies in province)
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +3

Winds of Magic power reserve minimum: +3
	(own armies in province)
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +7

Winds of Magic power reserve minimum: +5
	(own armies in province)
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +15

skillTree.localised_description: A bauble, talisman, or relic, growing in power with the experience of its attuner.
The most formidable Imperial wizards have an unquenchable thirst for knowledge and a consuming need to constantly expand their magical repertoire.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2% for all spells
Winds of Magic cost: -4% for all spells
Winds of Magic cost: -8% for all spells

skillTree.localised_description: Carefully preparing a series of overlapping deflection spells before engaging in combat can mean the difference between life and death.
Plans upon plans passed down from the Imperial college in Altdorf unite the wizards in purpose and give them laser focus in their tasks.

effects.description:
Hero action success chance: +1% for Wizards
	(all characters factionwide)

Hero action success chance: +2% for Wizards
	(all characters factionwide)

Hero action success chance: +3% for Wizards
	(all characters factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: By sharing their knowledge of scrying with the younger wizards, their keen senses are amplified to a whole new level.

effects.description:
Magic item drop chance: +1%
	(all characters factionwide)

Magic item drop chance: +3%
	(all characters factionwide)

Magic item drop chance: +5%
	(all characters factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: The ability to convince other wizards to follow your lead is a rare and exceptionally valuable gift.
The caster weaves a confounding fog that numbs and deludes enemies, causing them to stumble and stagger.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A conjured shadow is just as obfuscating as a real one - the Shadow Wizard is master or mistress of the 'concealing' arts.
When cast, this spell enfeebles enemy minds; they feel the crushing weight of reality bearing down upon them.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Enfeebling Foe"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The Wizard destroys their enemies from within, corroding foes' minds with doubt and crisis.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Withering"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Withering Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Withering Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A spectral pendulum is summoned by the Wizard. On command, it swings, razor sharp and with lethal speed, through the foe.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Penumbral Pendulum"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The spellcaster opens a vortex leading into the Pit. Anything caught within it will be lost forever.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Pit of Shades Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The supernatural solution is often the best; weapons materialise before the caster's allies, allowing them to slice through flesh, soul, and consciousness.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Okkam's Mindrazor"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Drain the winds of magic before the enemy can turn them against us.

effects.description:
Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: -5
	(enemy armies in region)
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Practiced in the art of casting; always with a spell at the ready.
Your life is balanced on the edge of a knife when drawing from the winds. Too swift, and the winds will claim your life. Too slow, and the enemy will.

	(own characters in region)

Miscast base chance: -2%
	(own characters in region)

Miscast base chance: -4%
	(own characters in region)

skillTree.localised_description: He who casts the first spell draws first blood.

skillTree.localised_description: With the right amount of preparation, everything can harnessed to empower even the soldier’s mundane weapons.

	(own armies in region)

Weapon strength: +2% when attacking
	(own armies in region)

Weapon strength: +3% when attacking
	(own armies in region)

skillTree.localised_description: So great is this one’s raw power that the winds gust in unison.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +2 per turn
	(own armies in region)

skillTree.localised_description: Spellcasters can oft-sense when magic is close or being drawn from the Winds.

Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.localised_description: Such magic-users may be wise and able to offer sage advice, especially if they have scried the region.

effects.description: Boost Income action: Income is modified by an additional 2%
Boost Income action: Income is modified by an additional 4%
Boost Income action: Income is modified by an additional 6%

skillTree.localised_description: Oft-times, though you may have much, what you want the most is what your rivals have; such envy focuses the mind and creativity.

effects.description: Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 3%
Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 6%
Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 10%

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 15% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 30% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: Lying in wait, experienced and patient, striking when the foe least expects.

effects.description: Assault Units action: Additional 3% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 8% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

items.colour_text: Used by Imperial mages, the wand aids spellcasting by increasing the chances of its success.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: A regal air? Let's see how long that lasts.

effects.description:
Experience gain: +5% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "The smallfolk should be thankful - without us, who would they work for?"

effects.description:
Construction time: -20% for all buildings
	(local region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Franz has put his trust in this man; pray he does not let him down!
"If it's got a scent and footprints, I'll find it. Also, it helps if it's absolutely huge and can be spotted a league away."

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

related_attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The thrill of the chase, the tremor as the quarry is cornered, the ecstasy of the kill. These are the things that matter.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +20%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

effects.description:
Experience gain: +5% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.
Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

Ambush defence chance: +10%
	(all units in army)
